# Welcome

This repository provides a comprehensive toolkit for MSc students in Food and Nutrition Sciences, covering data analysis with Python, pandas, and statistical methods. Explore the sections below to access rendered notebooks and resources.

## Sections

- **Foundations and Tools** ([infrastructure/](docs/infrastructure/)): Environment setup, Git, and Quarto.
- **Programming Basics** ([programming_basics/](docs/programming_basics/)): Python syntax, functions, and OOP.
- **Data Handling** ([data_handling/](docs/data_handling/)): Importing, cleaning, and transforming data.
- **Data Analysis** ([data_analysis/](docs/data_analysis/)): Visualisation, statistics, and regression.
- **Advanced Techniques** ([advanced/](docs/advanced/)): Bayesian methods, dashboards, and databases.
- **Qualitative Tools** ([qualitative/](docs/qualitative/)): Surveys and text analysis.

## Getting Started

- **Colab**: Open notebooks at [colab.research.google.com](https://colab.research.google.com/).
- **Local**: Install Anaconda, run `pip install -r requirements.txt`.
- **Rendered Outputs**: Browse HTML/PDF versions in [docs/](docs/).
- **Repository**: [github.com/ggkuhnle/data-analysis-toolkit-FNS](https://github.com/ggkuhnle/data-analysis-toolkit-FNS).

## Datasets

- `nutrient_survey.csv`: Simulated nutrient intakes (iron, calcium).
- `nutrient_intakes.csv`: Calorie and protein data.
- `vitamin_trial.csv`: Vitamin D trial results.
- `food_preferences.txt`: Survey responses on food preferences.
